intro: Hieracium artabirense, commonly known as the Artabirian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its yellowish-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium artabirense is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold climates with a short growing season.
